[ckMath -- Mathematics module]

A 3-element vector which is represented by xyz coordinates. More...

Detailed Description

A 3-element vector which is represented by xyz coordinates.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ckVec::ckVec ( r32  x_,
r32  y_,
r32  z_ = 0.0f 
)

Constructs and initializes a ckVec from the specified xyz coordinates.

Parameters:
[in] x_ The x-coordinate.
[in] y_ The y-coordinate.
[in] z_ The z-coordinate. If not specified, 0.0f is used.

ckVec ckVec::rotateX_s32 ( s32  deg  )  const

Returns a ckVec which is this ckVec rotated around the orthonormal x-axis.

This method allows only an s32 type as an angle, but is faster than its r32 version.

Parameters:
[in] deg An s32 angle of rotation in degrees.
Returns:
A ckVec which is this ckVec rotated around the orthonormal x-axis.

r32  ratio 
) const

Returns a ckVec which is interpolated between this ckVec and an another ckVec by the specified ratio, using linear interpolation.

Parameters:
[in] to An another ckVec.
[in] ratio The value which indicates how far to interpolate between two ckVecs. This value is clamped between 0.0f and 1.0f.
Returns:
A ckVec which is interpolated between two ckVecs.
